step1.sentence: The surprising announcement was enough to trigger a response from even the most reserved members of the team.

step2.story: The manager's blunt email triggered a response from nearly every employee in the department. Within hours, the inbox was flooded with replies ranging from confusion to frustration.

step3.story: Dr. Patel had spent months testing different stimuli on the group of volunteers, carefully noting which ones triggered a response and which ones went unnoticed. One afternoon, a low-frequency sound she had nearly dismissed caused every participant to sit up sharply. She leaned forward, barely breathing, and watched the data stream across her monitor. It was the strongest reaction she had ever recorded in a controlled setting. She scribbled a note in the margin of her notebook: 'This one triggers a response every time — follow up immediately.'

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 어떤 자극이나 사건이 반응을 유발하다 또는 촉발하다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 사람, 시스템, 또는 집단이 특정 행동·발언·상황에 반응하도록 만들 때 사용하며, 감정적 반응뿐 아니라 물리적·기계적 반응에도 폭넓게 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'trigger'는 원래 총의 방아쇠를 뜻하는 명사였으나, 17세기 이후 '어떤 일을 촉발시키다'는 동사 의미로 확장되었다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 자동적이거나 즉각적인 반응을 암시하며, 원인과 결과의 연결이 강하고 직접적일 때 주로 사용한다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Loud noises can trigger a response in people with anxiety.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 큰 소음은 불안을 가진 사람들에게 반응을 유발할 수 있다.
